title: Massive fire destroys recycling centre
text:
Share on Twitter 
FIREFIGHTERS are battling a massive blaze that has destroyed a recycling centre in Chullora in Sydney’s south west. Fire crews were called to the Muir Rd factory about 9.20am this morning to find the facility fully engulfed in flames. A Fire and Rescue spokeswoman said it was the eighth alarm for the fire with 24 trucks and 96 firefighters called in to bring the inferno under control. A large fire has erupted at a recycling plant in Chullora. Picture: 7 News Source: Channel 7 The roof of the facility has collapsed under the intense heat. Picture: 7 News Source: Channel 7 “The westerly wind is taking smoke in an eastern direction and we have notified Bankstown airport of the smoke hazard,” a Fire and Rescue NSW spokeswoman said. Crews are currently staging on Anzac St.. “It will take a little while they are still in defensive mode,” the spokeswoman said. “It will be a protracted incident.” The roof of the centre has collapsed under the intense heat. Massive plumes of smoke seen from the blaze. Source: Twitter The roof of the recycling centre collapsed under the intense heat. Picture: 7 News Source: Channel 7 Fire crews battling the massive blaze. Picture: 7 News Source: Channel 7 Massive plumes of smoke could be seen across the city, including as far away as the CBD. Fire and Rescue NSW said all people were accounted for. Anzac and Bunker roads have been blocked off to traffic and people are being advised to avoid the area. The plumes of smoke can be seen from the CBD. Picture: Twitter Source: Twitter CHULLORA | #FRNSW f/fighters at waste recycling centre #fire . Large amount of smoke. Multiple crews on scene. All ppl accounted for.
